author: Marley Dickinson
title: Irish Olympian breaks womenâ€™s parkrun world record
text:
Irish Olympian breaks womenâ€™s parkrun world record
Ciara Mageean ran a speedy 15:13 in Belfast to take 12 seconds off the previous parkrun recordPhoto by: Kevin Morris
With December and January being down months for competition and racing, some distance runners need a place to test their fitness. On Dec. 23, Irish Olympian
Ciara Mageean put her training to the test at Victoria Park parkrun in Belfast, setting a new womenâ€™s parkrun world record of 15:13.
An astonishing run from Ciara Mageean as she becomes the fastest female park runner in history ğŸ”¥
The multiple major middle distance running medallist clocked an amazing 15:13 at Belfast Victoria ğŸ’¥
ğŸ“¸
[@EDAC_Youtube] [pic.twitter.com/wDQMlAquwc]
â€” AW (@AthleticsWeekly)
[December 23, 2023]
The 31-year-old, who finished fourth in the womenâ€™s 1,500m at the 2023 World Athletics Championships in Budapest, ran the timed 5K course 12 seconds faster than the previous record holder, Australiaâ€™s
Izzi Batt-Doyle.
Batt-Doyle ran 15:25 to set the record at the Aldinga Beach parkrun, just outside her hometown of Adelaide, Australia, in December 2022.
Parkrun is a weekly, free, community-based timed 5K where you can run, jog and/or walk in parks and open spaces around the world. Every parkrun event is 5K and is held on Saturday morning.
â€œItâ€™s a nice way to start the Christmas period,â€ Mageean said about her
new record to Athletics Weekly. â€œItâ€™s a big one with the Olympics coming up in the summer and World Indoors and European Champs too in the run-up to it. Iâ€™ve had a good winter (training) block too with solid work, so itâ€™s good to come out and run a good 5K here.â€
Her 5K parkrun record caps off an impressive breakout season for Mageean, who broke Irish national records in the 800m, 1,500m and mile on her way to her fourth-place finish at Worlds in August.
The concept of parkrun began in Londonâ€™s Bushy Park in 2004, with the aim to create an inclusive and community-focused event that encouraged people of all ages and fitness levels to participate in a timed 5K run or walk. It remains one of the most popular weekly run groups across the world.
If you are interested in checking out or volunteering at a local parkrun, you can find your nearest parkrun
here.
